rules.title: Constitution of the Tribunal
rules.summary: Defines how the arbitral tribunal is constituted and prevents proceedings from being frustrated by lack of agreement.

rules.title: Nationality of Arbitrators
rules.summary: Requires that the majority of arbitrators differ in nationality from the disputing parties unless otherwise agreed.

rules.title: Competence of the Tribunal
rules.summary: Empowers the tribunal to determine its own jurisdiction and decide jurisdictional objections.

rules.title: Applicable Procedure
rules.summary: Establishes the procedural hierarchy: Convention, Arbitration Rules, and party agreement, with limited tribunal discretion.

rules.title: Award and Supplementation
rules.summary: Governs decision-making, form of awards, and correction or supplementation of omitted issues.

rules.title: Annulment – Fundamental Rule of Procedure
rules.summary: Provides annulment where there is a serious departure from a fundamental rule of procedure.
